roleset.name: entertain, put on a show

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: The FBI is reportedly performing DNA test on human remains from last month 's bombing of the `` USS Cole . ''

propbank.arg: on human remains from last month 's bombing of the `` USS Cole

example.name: autogen1
example.text: Robert Loggia 's riveting performance as the unlovable -- evencrotchety -- veteran agent

propbank.arg: as the unlovable -- evencrotchety -- veteran agent

example.name: autogen2
example.text: his usual straight - from - the - shoulder performance of MacBeth

example.name: just arg1, adjectival
example.text: When a musical performance is scheduled , someone will always take it upon themselves to set out seats for the audience .

example.name: with TMP
example.text: After the 10 - minute performance ended , the hall was rocked by thunderous applause .

example.name: PP arg1 (I don't know if this is a typo or a title, but either way)
example.text: And Gao himself will direct a performance of his August Snow at the end of the year .

example.name: just arg0
example.text: For her performance , Byrne won the best actress award at last year 's Venice Film Festival .

example.name: If only she could keep a beat. All args.
example.text: The White Stripes documentary ends with their piano performance of " White Moon " , which made Meg cry .

roleset.note: PERFORM-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Comparison with play. Member of VNcls performance-26.7-1. (from perform.01-v)
PERFORMANCE-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls performance-26.7. (from performance.01-n)

roleset.name: carry out a task or action

role.descr: action/tasks performed, kind of tasks done

example.name: performance-n: all args
example.text: Merk 's strong sales performance in the human and animal health - products segment .

propbank.arg: in the human and animal health - products segment

example.name: performance-n: just arg1
example.text: Academic performance ranged from excellent to failure

example.name: performance-n: ARG0 and ARG2 and ARG1
example.text: The Bank of China , the largest foreign exchange bank in China , had good business performance in 1997 , and realized a profit of 6.033 billion yuan for the whole year , of which domestic banks realized a profit of 2.428 billion yuan .

propbank.arg: The Bank of China , the largest foreign exchange bank in China

example.name: performance-n: potentially unintuitive args 1 and 2
example.text: United posted the best on - time performance .

example.name: performance-n
example.text: I think by any standard , his debate performance was very , very good .

example.name: performance-n: args 0 and 1 again
example.text: the unit 's financial performance this year

example.name: performance-n: just arg2
example.text: Mr. Curcio was succeeded by Ralph E. Reins as chief executive officer following several quarters of lackluster or declining performance .

example.name: performance-n
example.text: Mr. Jefferies 's performance as a witness was expected to affect his sentencing .

example.name: perform-v: transitive
example.text: If the money manager performing this service is being paid by his clients to match or beat the return of the S & P 500 index , he is likely to remain fully invested at all times .

example.name: perform-v: with manner
example.text: Analysts said the fall in pretax profit was due to the group 's recent restructuring and sale of peripheral units , and that its remaining businesses are performing well .

roleset.note: PERFORMANCE-N NOTES: Reframed by Julia. No Vncls. (from performance.02-n)
These two rolesets (.01 and .02) share verbal counterpart frame, but their syntax is different enough here in the nominalized forms that it became necessary to separate them. (from performance.02-n)
